title: I just received a Notice of Levy under the Writ of Execution, what should I do? I do not have money for an attorney.
question: I received a Notice of Levy mailed on 7/24/2009 for a debt of close to $12,000. The paperwork states that my personal possession could be ceased. What should I do?
answers:
If they have actually obtained a judgment and now are collecting on it - I'd expect them to try and take money from your accounts and attach your wages.

If you think they may know your account #s, then I would end up keeping them empty of any money you can't afford to lose. (pay bills by money order). Can't do much about going after you wages - but you are allowed to keep a certain amount.

Do they have a judgment? What is it for? If you can't afford an attorney - try to give as much information on here as you can so someone might be willing to give you specific advice, otherwise, try library or internet. There use to be a book (I don't know if still published), titled money troubles, legal strategies to cope with your debts which might help.

Please remember, this is not specific advice, just general information based upon a general question and goes not create an attorney client relationship.

Good luck with your situation.

Matthew Williamson
